intro: Ardisia luquillensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and related shrubs. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the summer. Following flowering, it develops bright red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Ardisia luquillensis is typically found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
